intro: Persoonia, commonly known as the "ghost tuber" or "bottlebrush plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Proteaceae, native to Australia. It is characterized by its unique, often tubular or bottlebrush-like flowers, which can range in color from white to pink, red, or yellow. Many species have woody stems and produce small, clustered leaves. The plant's name honors the 18th-century Dutch botanist Nicolaas Jacobus Persoon. Persoonia species are often found in coastal or sandy soils and are adapted to dry or nutrient-poor environments.
